Package in.kncsolutions.dhelm.candlepattern.multiline

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BearishAbandonedBaby
    According to literature the bearish abandoned baby pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with white body followed by a doji candle with at least one shadow, followed by a long black candle, where the low of the doji candle is abovw the high of the previous white candle and the following black candle's high is lower than the low of the doji candle.
    BearishSidebySideWhiteLines
    According to literature the bearish side by side white lines pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with black body followed by two white candles, where the high of the latter two white candles are below the low of the first long black candle and opening and closing of the latter two candles are similar.The prior trend should be down trend.
    BullishAbandonedBaby
    According to literature the bullish abandoned baby pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with black body followed by a doji candle with at least one shadow, followed by a long white candle, where the high of the doji candle is below the low of the previous black candle and the following white candle's low is greater than the high of the doji candle.
    BullishSidebySideWhiteLines
    According to literature the bullish side by side white lines pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with white body followed by two white candles, where the low of the latter two white candles are above the high of the first long white candle and opening and closing of the latter two candles are similar.
    DownsideTasukiGap
    According to literature the downside tasuki gap pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with black body followed by a candle with black, followed by a white candle, where the high of the middle candle is below the low of the previous long black candle and the latest white candle's opening is within the body of the middle candle.
    EveningDojiStar
    According to literature the evening doji star pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with white body followed by a doji candle with at least one shadow, followed by a long black candle, where the closing of the doji candle is above the closing of the previous white candle and the following black candle's opening is lower than the closing of the doji candle.
    EveningStar
    According to literature the evening star pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with white body followed by a white or black short candle, followed by a long black candle, where the body of the middle candle is above the closing of the previous white candle and the following black candle's opening is lower than the body of the middle candle.
    MorningDojiStar
    According to literature the morning doji star pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with black body followed by a doji candle with at least one shadow, followed by a long white candle, where the closing of the doji candle is below the closing of the previous black candle and the following white candle's opening is greater than the closing of the doji candle.
    MorningStar
    According to literature the morning star pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with black body followed by a short candle with with either white or black body, followed by a long white candle, where the body of the middle short candle is below the closing of the previous black candle and the following white candle's opening is above the body of the middle candle.
    RisingThreeMethod
    According to literature the rising three method pattern is a five line pattern composed of a long candle with white body followed by three candles with black bodies, followed by a long white candle.
    ThreeBlackCrows
    According to literature the three black crows pattern is a three line pattern composed of three consecutive long candle with black bodies, where the closing of each candle is lesser than the closing of previous candle and opening of each candle is within the body of the prior candle.
    ThreeInsideDown
    According to literature the three inside down pattern is a three line pattern composed of a bearish harami pattern followed by a black candle , where the closing of the latest black candle is below the closing of the second candle(which is a black candle) of the previous bearish harami pattern.
    ThreeInsideUp
    According to literature the three inside up pattern is a three line pattern composed of a bullish harami pattern followed by a white candle , where the closing of the white candle is above the closing of the second candle(which is a white candle) of the previous bullish harami pattern.
    ThreeOutsideDown
    According to literature the three outside down pattern is a three line pattern composed of a bearish engulfing pattern followed by a black candle , where the closing of the black candle is below the closing of the second candle(which is a black candle) of the previous bearish engulfing pattern.
    ThreeOutsideUp
    According to literature the three outside up pattern is a three line pattern composed of a bullish engulfing pattern followed by a white candle , where the closing of the white candle is above the closing of the second candle(which is a white candle) of the previous bullish engulfing pattern.
    ThreeWhiteSoldiers
    According to literature the three white soldiers pattern is a three line pattern composed of three consecutive long candle with white bodies, where the closing of each candle is greater than the closing of previous candle and opening of each candle is within the body of the prior candle.
    UpsideTasukiGap
    According to literature the upside tasuki gap pattern is a three line pattern composed of a long candle with white body followed by a candle with white, followed by a black candle, where the low of the middle candle is above the high of the previous long white candle and the latest black candle's opening is within the body of the middle candle.
